events.summary: On October 3, 2025, the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) abruptly terminated its agreement with Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), which had facilitated medical care for ICE detainees. This decision left ICE without a mechanism to provide necessary medical services, such as dialysis and chemotherapy, to detainees. ICE described the situation as an "absolute emergency." Despite signing no-bid contracts on October 25 to replace the VA's services, the new systems are not yet operational. This has resulted in detainees being denied essential medical care, as detailed in a federal class action lawsuit filed on November 12.
events.title: VA Terminates Agreement with ICE, Halting Medical Care for Detainees

events.summary: On November 19, 1863, President Abraham Lincoln delivered the Gettysburg Address during the dedication ceremony of the Soldiers' National Cemetery in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania. The event was attended by about fifteen thousand people, including state governors and members of Congress. Lincoln's brief but impactful speech emphasized the principles of equality and democracy, urging the living to commit to the unfinished work of ensuring that the nation would endure as a government "of the people, by the people, for the people."

events.summary: The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has approved a revision to the Maricopa County Air Quality Department's portion of the Arizona State Implementation Plan (SIP). This revision concerns the regulation of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) emissions from petroleum solvents used in dry cleaning. The rule, effective December 19, 2025, incorporates Maricopa County's Rule 333 into the SIP, making it federally enforceable under the Clean Air Act. This action replaces the previous version of Rule 333 in the SIP.
events.title: EPA Approves Arizona SIP Revision for VOC Emissions
events.why_relevant: This approval strengthens air quality regulations by ensuring local rules meet federal standards, impacting environmental protection and public health.
